clinical_study.brief_title: Does Detailed Informed Consent for Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation and Mechanical Ventilation Impact Patients' Decisions and Outcomes?
clinical_study.official_title: Does Detailed Informed Consent for Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation and Mechanical Ventilation Impact Patients' Decisions and Outcomes?

brief_summary.textblock: There is evidence to suggest that patients make different end-of-life decisions if they understand the risks, benefits and alternatives of CPR and mechanical ventilation. This study will examine whether evidence-based informed consent impacts patients choices and healthcare outcomes compared to routine care.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research

arm_group.description: Patients remain full code, or 'routine care'.
Patients who watch CPR mechanical ventilation video and hear script that changed their code status.

intervention.description: Patients will be randomized to receive the intervention or routine care. The intervention is a scripted discussion (see addendum) AND a 3 minute video produced at Harvard for similar studies that depicts CPR and mechanical ventilation that will be delivered by study staff in the first 24 hours of admission. The video showing CPR and MV is open to the public and has been used in several similar published informed consent studies: http://www.acpdecisions.org/videos/generic-cpr/
